duties_responsibilities.duty: Provides high-quality nursing care to assigned patients using the nursing process.
Documents patient assessment, progress, and necessary care accurately and timely.
Promotes patient safety and quality care, adhering to all necessary standards and requirements.
Communicates and collaborates with the healthcare team effectively, escalating situations as needed.
Administers medication and therapy according to policy and procedure, including blood administration.
Establishes priorities for patient care delivery, utilizes critical thinking skills, and coordinates patient care responsibilities independently or by delegating appropriately.
Provides patient/family education and assists in discharge planning, considering patient/family readiness, barriers, and alternatives.
Demonstrates knowledge and skills necessary to provide nursing care based on physical, psychosocial, educational, safety, and age-related criteria.

education_certification.credential: Must be a graduate of an Accredited Nursing Program, Registered Nurse License-NYS, BLS Certification.
ACLS, NIHSS and 8 hours of Stroke education required within 3 months
